summary: This is an email chain from April 26, 2019, between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing the preparation of an update memo on the Epstein case for an upcoming meeting with Brad Weinsheimer. The emails coordinate who will draft the memo and note that a key individual has not reviewed it due to travel.

persons.name: Brad Weinsheimer
persons.context: Mentioned as the person with whom a meeting is scheduled on Monday regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Scheduled meeting with Brad Weinsheimer
events.description: A meeting is scheduled for Monday (April 29, 2019) between a USANYS individual and Brad Weinsheimer to discuss the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) was actively working on the Epstein case as of late April 2019.
An update memo summarizing progress and next steps on the Epstein investigation was being prepared for internal review.
The email chain indicates coordination among multiple individuals within the USANYS, with at least one key person traveling and unavailable for immediate review.
The communication was internal and not intended for immediate distribution to Washington, D.C.
